item.title: A Closer Look at Trump's Second-Term Agenda
item.description: The Republican front-runner’s proposals would extend the role of the federal government.

item.title: Trump's Second-Term Plans: Anti-'Woke' University, 'Freedom Cities'
item.description: Past generations of Republicans campaigned against one-size-fits-all federal dictates and argued that local officials were best positioned to oversee their communities.

item.title: Welcome to the Tiny Island Paradise Fending Off China
item.description: Thitu Island in the South China Sea has 250 residents, and they are determined to stay despite ever-present Chinese ships on the horizon.

item.title: My Morning With Charlie Munger
item.description: Reporter Gregory Zuckerman’s wide-ranging interview before the billionaire’s death was packed with candor, lessons and the odd lament.

item.title: A Divorce With Apple, Internal Strife: How Goldman's Main Street Bet Failed
item.description: The Wall Street firm was looking to get out of consumer lending, once a big area of expansion. But Apple dumped it first.

item.title: Amazon said it hired Musk's SpaceX to conduct three rocket launches for the Seattle company's planned satellite-internet division.
item.description: Amazon said it hired Musk’s SpaceX to conduct three rocket launches for the Seattle company’s planned satellite-internet division.

item.title: Hopes that the Fed is done raising rates turbocharged a rally.The Dow added 2.4% for the week, notching a fifth weekly gain, its longest winning streak since late 2021, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq added 0.8% and 0.4%, respectively.
item.description: Hopes that the Fed is done raising rates turbocharged a rally. The Dow added 2.4% for the week, notching a fifth weekly gain, its longest winning streak since late 2021, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq added 0.8% and 0.4%, respectively.

item.title: Neiman Marcus rejected Saks Fifth Avenue's most recent takeover offer this week, which valued the upscale chain at close to $3 billion, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.description: Neiman Marcus rejected Saks Fifth Avenue’s most recent takeover offer this week, which valued the upscale chain at close to $3 billion, according to people familiar with the situation.

item.title: Chinese property giant Evergrande and its biggest foreign creditors are negotiating a deal to prevent a liquidation of the company's offshore businesses on Monday, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Chinese property giant Evergrande and its biggest foreign creditors are negotiating a deal to prevent a liquidation of the company’s offshore businesses on Monday, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Apple and Paramount have discussed bundling their streaming services at a discount, the latest attempt by rival entertainment giants to team up.
item.description: Apple and Paramount have discussed bundling their streaming services at a discount, the latest attempt by rival entertainment giants to team up.

item.title: Meta has spent months trying to fix child-safety problems on Instagram and Facebook, but it is struggling to prevent its own systems from enabling and even promoting a vast network of pedophile accounts.
item.description: Meta has spent months trying to fix child-safety problems on Instagram and Facebook, but it is struggling to prevent its own systems from enabling and even promoting a vast network of pedophile accounts.

item.title: Ukraine's Zelensky ordered the construction of a network of fortifications aimed at holding back Russian forces, signaling a switch to the defensive posture after a Ukrainian counteroffensive yielded only small gains.
item.description: Ukraine’s Zelensky ordered the construction of a network of fortifications aimed at holding back Russian forces, signaling a switch to the defensive posture after a Ukrainian counteroffensive yielded only small gains.

item.title: Negotiators scrambled to reinstate a weeklong truce between Israel and Hamas that expired, as both sidesresumed fightinga nearly two-month-old war.
item.description: Negotiators scrambled to reinstate a weeklong truce between Israel and Hamas that expired, as both sides resumed fighting a nearly two-month-old war.

item.title: Sandra Day O'Connor, the first woman appointed to the Supreme Court and its most powerful justice for much of her tenure, died at 93.
item.description: Sandra Day O’Connor, the first woman appointed to the Supreme Court and its most powerful justice for much of her tenure, died at 93.

item.title: The House voted to expel embattled Rep. Santos over allegations the New York Republican stole money from his own campaign and committed other misdeeds.
item.description: The House voted to expel embattled Rep. Santos over allegations the New York Republican stole money from his own campaign and committed other misdeeds.

item.title: Trump's efforts to claim absolute immunity to ward off criminal and civil legal actions against him were rebuffed twice in separate legal decisions.
item.description: Trump’s efforts to claim absolute immunity to ward off criminal and civil legal actions against him were rebuffed twice in separate legal decisions.
